title: How come Neeraj Epilepsy Clinic is still running?
selftext:
Recently I came to know about world famous Neeraj Epilepsy Clinic  in Rishikesh India, as some acquaintance was trying to use it for epilepsy treatment. So I did some search.

Google  have 2125 reviews with average 4.7 star, wow

Hindustan time has a article: Neeraj Clinic Provides Effective Epilepsy Treatment

[https://www.hindustantimes.com/brand-stories/neeraj-clinic-provides-effective-epilepsy-treatment-under-the-aegis-of-smpl-101669285617665.html](https://www.hindustantimes.com/brand-stories/neeraj-clinic-provides-effective-epilepsy-treatment-under-the-aegis-of-smpl-101669285617665.html)

but that is a paid advertisement, similar paid articles in DNA etc.

Ok so I started searching more and found this

In 2017 R. K. Gupta founder of Neeraj Clinic was sentenced to 5 years

[https://thelogicalindian.com/health/quack-epilepsy-specialist-sent-to-prison-by-court/](https://thelogicalindian.com/health/quack-epilepsy-specialist-sent-to-prison-by-court/)

excerpt from above:

>“in the year 2000 — a three-member delegation comprising of Dr. V.N. Sharma, Dr. S.P. Singh and Dr. J. Rao of Karnataka of Indian Medical Association (IMA) anti-quackery cell visited and checked the working of the so-called epilepsy expert. They declared Gupta a quack. It was found that he was using Ashoka emblem on his prescription pad without holding any government office from which he should be punished. According to the findings, he was not even a registered medical practitioner. ”  


though he was released after 28 days, for lack of evidence

[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/dehradun/doon-court-acquits-neeraj-clinics-rk-gupta/articleshow/62973168.cms](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/dehradun/doon-court-acquits-neeraj-clinics-rk-gupta/articleshow/62973168.cms)

excerpt from above:

>It is to be noted that police had made an attempt to arrest Gupta on August 3, 2004, but people of Rishikesh protested and an angry crowd managed to free him. Gupta was accused of administering psychotropic substances to his patients in Neeraj Clinic.

Further search found these two other cases:

RK gupta vs bhanwar kanwar (patient from 1993)

[https://nja.gov.in/Concluded\_Programmes/2018-19/SE-11\_Mar\_2019\_PPTs/3.Bhanwar\_Kanwar\_vs\_R.K.Gupta\_Anr\_on\_5\_April,\_2013.pdf](https://nja.gov.in/Concluded_Programmes/2018-19/SE-11_Mar_2019_PPTs/3.Bhanwar_Kanwar_vs_R.K.Gupta_Anr_on_5_April,_2013.pdf)

RK gupta vs neeru gupta (2006)

[https://www.casemine.com/judgement/in/590a32754a932663936ff33a](https://www.casemine.com/judgement/in/590a32754a932663936ff33a)

As recent as 2019, they were making news

[https://m.timesofindia.com/city/dehradun/2-held-for-passing-off-unauthorised-meds-as-epilepsy-cure/amp\_articleshow/72298882.cms](https://m.timesofindia.com/city/dehradun/2-held-for-passing-off-unauthorised-meds-as-epilepsy-cure/amp_articleshow/72298882.cms)

>According to police, Neeraj Clinic in the city had allegedly been giving out loose medicines. The head of the clinic, Dr RK Gupta, is absconding.

​

So now I am sitting here wondering, after all these cases, how come this is still allowed to run?
